document.title: Green Bonds 101
document.description: An introduction to green bonds and how they finance environmental projects.
document.author: TGF Team

body.raw:
Green bonds are fixed-income instruments designed to fund projects with positive environmental benefits.
They follow established frameworks and verification standards to ensure transparency and accountability.

Key attributes include use-of-proceeds, reporting, and third-party reviews.

document.title: How We Select Projects
document.description: Our criteria for sourcing and diligencing projects at TGF.
document.author: TGF Team

body.raw:
We assess additionality, scalability, governance, and community engagement. Each project undergoes
risk assessment and impact modeling prior to approval.

document.title: Measuring Impact That Matters
document.description: How TGF evaluates and reports impact across projects.
document.author: TGF Team

body.raw:
We prioritize metrics that reflect real-world outcomes: emissions avoided, beneficiaries reached, and
financial inclusion. Our approach combines standardized indicators with project-specific KPIs.
